glsa.title: Pidgin: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in Pidgin might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Pidgin is a GTK Instant Messenger client for a variety of instant messaging protocols.

description.p: Joseph Bisch discovered that Pidgin incorrectly handled certain xml messages.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted instant message, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the Pidgin process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Pidgin users should upgrade to the latest version:
